div.l: Fer in þe north I can nouȝt telle where
Þis aleyn makeþ redi alle his gere
And on an hors þe sak he cast anoon
Forth goth Aleyn þe clerc and also Iohn
Wit good swerd ⁊and wit bokeler by his syde
Iohn knew the wey him neded no gide
And atte Milne þe sak a doun he layth
Alayn spak first al hail symon in faith
How fares þi faire doughter and þi wif
Alayn welcome qduod symkyn be my lif
And Iohn also how now what do ȝe here
Bi god qduod Iohn Symond nede has no pere
Him by houes serue him self þat has no swayn
Or elles he is a fool as Clerkꝭes sayn
Oure manciple I hope he wil be dede
Swa werkes him ay þe wanges in his hede
And þerfore is I come and ek Aleyn
To grynde oure corn and carie it ham a gayn
I pray yow spedes vs hethen þat ye may
It shal be don qduod symkyn bi my fay
¶ What wil ye don whil þat is in hande
Bi god right bi þe hoper wil I stande
Qduod Iohn and see how gates þe corn gas Inne
Yt saugh I neủere by my fader kynne
How þat the hoper wagges til and fra
Aleyn answard Iohn wiltow swa
Than wil I be by nethe be my croune
And see how gates þe mele falles doune
In til þe troughe þat sall be my disporte
Qduod Iohn in faath I may be of youre sorte
I is as ylle a Meller as ere ye
This Millere smylede of here nycite
And thought al þis nys don but for a wile
Thei wene that noman may þem be gyle
But be my thrift yit shal I blere here eye
For al þe sleight in her philosophie
The more queynte Crekes þat þei make
The more wil I stele whan I take
In stede of flour yet wil I yeue hem brenne
The grettest Clerkes ben nouȝt þe wisest mēnne
As whilom to þe wolf þus spake þe Mare
Of alle here art counte I nouȝt a tare
